entry.title: Multiparty signatures
entry.summary: In a conversation between Gregory Maxwell and Tim Ruffing via the bitcoin-dev mailing list, they discuss the security of non-interactive signatures. Maxwell suggests that these types of signatures may be more secure, to which Ruffing replies that Schnorr signatures already allow for the functionality desired. The conversation references a BIP (Bitcoin Improvement Proposal) on multisignatures and threshold signatures. However, no further information is given on the content of this proposal.
